column2: one of the grocery man's best customers—a deacon in the church—had come in and sat down on the counter
column4: and as the grocery man came in with the coal
column6: and went out door and tipped over a basket of rutabagas
column7: while the deacon got down off the counter with his hand clasped
column9: and told the grocery man he could whip him in two minutes. The grocery man asked what was the matter
column10: and the deacon hunted up the source from whence the darning needle came through the counter
column11: and as the boy went across the street
column12: the deacon and the grocery man were rolling on the floor
column13: the grocery man trying to hold the deacon's fists while he explained about the darning needle
column14: and that it was intended for the boy. How it came out the boy did not wait to see.
